content: If a car travels at a constant speed of 50 miles per hour, how far will it travel in 2.5 hours?

If a car is moving at a steady speed of 50 miles per hour, to find out how far it will go in 2.5 hours, you can use the formula for distance, which is:

\[ \text{distance} = \text{speed} \times \text{time} \]

So, plugging in the values:

\[ \text{distance} = 50 \, \text{miles per hour} \times 2.5 \, \text{hours} \]

When you multiply these, you get:

\[ \text{distance} = 125 \, \text{miles} \]

Therefore, the car will travel 125 miles in 2.5 hours at a constant speed of 50 miles per hour.
